jobDescription: Overview Visiting Nurse Service of New York (VNSNY) is the nations largest not-for-profit community-based health system. VNSNY provides a comprehensive array of home- and community-based programs, including health plans, tailored to the needs of high-risk, vulnerable New Yorkers, improving their quality of life. Each day,more than 18,000 VNSNY employees including nurses, rehabilitation therapists, social workers, dieticians, other allied professionals, and paraprofessionals deliver compassionate care, unparalleled medical expertise, and 24/7 solutions and resources tomore than35,000 patients, helping them to live the best lives possible. Responsibilities Functions as a Data Warehouse Developer / Analyst responsible for building, enhancing and maintaining an Enterprise Data Warehouse that serves the reporting and analytical needs for the Enterprise, as well as IT consumers. Participates in Systems Delivery Life Cycle (SDLC) method for Data Integration projects including preparing detailed technical design documents from functional requirement documents, designing and developing ETL (Extract, Transform and Load) framework, establishing DB application schemas and developing database code, participating in unit and system testing of end-to-end integration, and performing release management and production support as needed. Works under general supervision. Education: Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or a related field required. Experience: Minimum of three years of experience in Data Integration projects working on ETL frameworks for Data Warehouse projects preferably using Informatica 9.x/10. X required. Hands on experience creating mappings, mapplets, sessions, workflows, and worklets required. Experience with performance tuning techniques on mapping and session levels (DTM buffer/block size configurations, partitioning etc.) required. Working experience in using parameters and variables required. Experience with Oracle database development for data warehouse project including writing complex SQL queries, PL SQL functions, procedures and packages required. Knowledge of SQLServer SQL queries and T-SQL procedures preferred Familiarity with NoSQL databases and general Big data concepts and technologies preferred. Hands on experience in performance tuning of SQLs required. Experience in Unix/Linux shell or Python scripting required. Experience with Advanced Scheduling tools such as Control-M, Autosys or Tivoli etc. required. Working knowledge of data modeling, and understating various aspects of logical, conceptual and physical modeling of data warehouse projects required. Ability to work independently, take initiative and contribute to new ideas required. Familiarity with cloud related technologies as related to data integration required. Working knowledge of an analytics platform/Visualization tool such as Oracle OBIEE, Microstrategy or Tableau required. CA2018
